Apply Now        Request Information        Events                                                                                     M.S. in Publishing: Digital and Print Media          feature subtitle 1          feature text                             The M.S. in Publishing: Digital and Print Media , offered through the NYU School of Professional Studies Center for Publishing, provides you with a solid foundation in book and magazine publishing, with a major focus on digital media. The program develops the core competencies of content creation and editing, while also emphasizing the business, digital media, and marketing skills that are necessary to secure leadership roles in the industry.   With a goal of exposing you to "real-world, real-workplace" scenarios, the curriculum reflects the most current industry trends, including best practices in e-books, apps, and mobile platforms and video. Your studies begin with core courses that provide a comprehensive framework in the essential elements of the publishing process. Media specialization courses delve into the most critical business aspects of the industry and provide the expertise needed to master them.       The core course requirements are designed to provide you with an in-depth understanding of the most important elements of publishing. While completing the core courses, you also take courses from three media specializations: media content development, media marketing and distribution, and media profitability. Advanced seminars provide a thorough exploration of key industry topics. You complete the program with a capstone project that allows you to draw on the skills you’ve acquired.   While rigorous coursework is key to your success in the program, you also will be provided with numerous opportunities to expand your publishing knowledge outside of the classroom. In addition to industry events and visits, the M.S. in Publishing: Digital and Print Media has developed a strong global program. As the publishing industry becomes not only more digital, but global, an understanding of international publishing practices is imperative. Students are invited to apply for trips to international book fairs and conferences, where they can volunteer their time in return for the opportunity to participate in global events and discussions. In recent years, students have served as marketing, publicity, and educational programming volunteers at the Frankfurt, London, Abu Dhabi, and Sharjah (UAE) international book fairs and at the FIPP International Magazine conference in Rome. These opportunities are underwritten by department grants for a select number of students.           Program Location : NYU Midtown Center                 From the Director                                                       Andrea Chambers        "Our goal is to prepare today’s professional for success and career satisfaction."          Read More                      Specializations           Media Content Development         Media Marketing and Distribution         Media Profitability                 View General Curriculum            Learn More            NYU School of Professional Studies faculty and staff members look forward to learning more about you, and we want you to learn more about us, to ensure that your decisions regarding your educational experience are well informed. Our admissions staff is here to partner with you throughout the admissions process. Please do not hesitate to contact us .                   Ready to Proceed? Curriculum                                                                                          The NYU School of Professional Studies Website    Faculty    Degrees    Professional Certificates    Upcoming Events        Search Courses     Credit Course     Non-Credit Course          Site    Noncredit Courses    Faculty                                                                       Center for Publishing                                                                                           About             Director's Message Faculty Advisory Board News Watch Videos                   Admissions                 Academics             Graduate Offerings Noncredit Offerings Summer Publishing Institute Advanced Digital Publishing Institute                   Career                 Events             NYU Media Talk                   Initiatives             Publisher's Training Program                   Alumni                                                   Curriculum                                            Academics ›                Graduate Offerings                 Curriculum          Opportunities and Outcomes          Faculty          Admissions Process          Advisory Board                   Noncredit Offerings            Summer Publishing Institute            Advanced Digital Publishing Institute            Watch Videos                               Ready to Proceed?           Apply Now        Request Information        Events                                                              The M.S. in Publishing: Digital and Print Media is a 42-credit program that includes a core curriculum designed to provide a broad overview of traditional and digital publishing, specialization courses, advanced seminars, and a capstone project. Advanced seminar courses are geared to furnish students with professionally relevant information on important publishing topics. The culminating capstone project requires comprehensive research on a key subject in publishing and the creation of a viable business plan that demonstrates the knowledge and the skills you have acquired throughout your program of study. An optional for-credit internship experience helps you to gain hands-on industry experience and to develop valuable professional contacts.   The program is structured to meet the needs of both working professionals and full-time students, allowing opportunities for either full-time or part-time evening study in any semester. Typically, students complete the degree within two years of full-time study or within two to five years of part-time study.           Expand All   Collapse All          Core Curriculum                     Course     Title     Credits                                           PUBB1-GC1005                                                    Introduction to Book Publishing                         1.5                                                PUBB1-GC1010                                                    Introduction to Magazine Media                         1.5                                                PUBB1-GC1100                                                    Management and Leadership in Transitional Times                         3.0                                                PUBB1-GC1150                                                    Intro to Multimedia Financial Analysis                         3.0                                                PUBB1-GC1155                                                    Multimedia Financial Analysis II                         3.0                                                PUBB1-GC1200                                                    Introduction to Marketing & Branding                         3.0                                                PUBB1-GC1250                                                    Publishing & Internet Law                         3.0                                                PUBB1-GC1360                                                    Introduction to Digital Media                         1.5                             Media Specializations        Students are required to take one course in each specialization and four total.            Media Content Development                     Course     Title     Credits                                           PUBB1-GC3310                                                    Editing Creative Content                         3.0                                                PUBB1-GC3320                                                    Book Acquisition & Editing                         3.0                                                PUBB1-GC3360                                                    Web Architecture & Content Creation                         3.0                                                PUBB1-GC3370                                                    Desktop Publishing                         3.0                                                PUBB1-GC3375                                                    Advanced Desktop Publishing                         3.0                                                PUBB1-GC3380                                                    Children's Book Publishing: An Intensive                         3.0                                                                 Advanced Seminars In:             1.5                                                               Advanced Book Editing; Advanced Magazine Editing; Children’s Book Editing; Editorial Fundamentals; EPUB & eBook Workflow; Graphic Novels/Manga; New Fiction Formats; Niche Markets: Mystery, Science Fiction, & Horror; Niche Markets: Romance; Non-Trade Book Publishing; Principles of Art & Design; The Role of the Literary Agent; The Role of Video in Publishing; Self-Publishing & POD; Tablet & App Creation & Management; Web Editing & Writing; and Website Production: Managing a Digital Brand.                                     Media Marketing and Distribution                     Course     Title     Credits                                           PUBB1-GC3110                                                    Book Distribution, Merchandising, & Sales                         3.0                                                PUBB1-GC3140                                                    Magazine Consumer Mrktng & Audience Development                         3.0                                                PUBB1-GC3160                                                    Media Advertising                         3.0                                                                 Advanced Seminars In:             1.5                                                               Book Marketing & Branding; Book Metadata & Infrastructure; Content Marketing; Magazine Marketing & Branding; Exploring User Interface Design; Public Relations & Corporate Communications; Research & Data Management; Social Media Marketing (introductory and advanced courses); and Web Analytics.                                     Media Profitability                     Course     Title     Credits                                           PUBB1-GC3200                                                    Magazine Brand Financials                         3.0                                                PUBB1-GC3210                                                    Book Publishing Financials                         3.0                                                PUBB1-GC3220                                                    From Idea to Empire: New Business Development                         3.0                                                PUBB1-GC3230                                                    The Global Marketplace: Challengs & Opportunties                         3.0                                                                 Advanced Seminars In:             1.5                                                               Contract Negotiation; Digital Financials: The Web, Apps, Tablets, & Video; Digital Management Strategies: Amazon, Apple, Facebook & Google; and eBooks & Digital Transformation: Methods & Models.                                        Electives                     Course     Title     Credits                                           PUBB1-GC3015                                                    Advanced Book Seminar:                         1.5                                                PUBB1-GC3025                                                    Advanced Magazine Seminar                         1.5                                                PUBB1-GC3035                                                    Advanced Management Seminar:                         1.5                                                PUBB1-GC3045                                                    Advanced Media Seminar                         1.5                                                PUBB1-GC3055                                                    Advanced Digital Seminar                         1.5                                                PUBB1-GC3065                                                    Advanced Law Seminar                         1.5                                                PUBB1-GC3075                                                    Adv Marketing Seminar:                         1.5                                                PUBB1-GC3910                                                    Internship in Publishing                         1.5                             Capstone                     Course     Title     Credits                                           PUBB1-GC1900                                                    Capstone                         3.0                                Ready to Proceed?
